google_play_reviews.content: Okinem koku na nos pa po trnju trcim bos
Reliable, open source
Not the most straightforward UI, but works flawlessly with Mac and Android.
Amazing app that does what it should do ver very well, i just wish it used less of my battery life to work.

This made my phone virtually unusable. It just took me nearly 15 minutes to get into settings to uninstall it - I was starting to think I was going to have to reset the phone! Don't tell me that it isn't capable enough; it's a Note 20 Ultra and handles everything else with aplomb. The only thing that changed was installing Syncthing, and it was back up and running as soon as I got that uninstalled.
Would not connect to WiFi even with precise location enabled.
i use this to sync obsidian vaults between devices and it works like a charm!
Can be hard for a newbie to understand how this works exactly. But after a little effort for that, it works like magic.
The best data sync app so far. It does require getting a bit technical but when configured it works well üëç

Mixed opinions, i use it to sync Obsidian on my laptop, desktop and android phone. The problem is if I update Notes on desktop, it creates a Conflict and so my mobile does not get updated unless I resolve conflict (ie by keeping the desktop file and ignoring laptop file). This should not happen. Solution would be syncthing only taking the last updated copy and disregarding previous ones.
This always my favorite FOSS... One urgent request Can you add a dedicated system toggle to make Syncthing Sync on/off? (I know this has been requesting for yesrs but still PLEASE consider.
Best syncing apps between local devices. Really love and appreciate it

Excellent product! Use it to backup photos videos and other files from your phone to one of your computers. Also, to keep important information in perfect sync. I use it on phone, 2 tablets, Windows, and Linux.
If you havebserver and know how to setup its amazing
Great alternative to one drive and Google drive
I have tried many apps for syncing and file transfer and this is the best one by far. Bless Up
godly

A great alternative to using cloud services. It takes some effort and organization to setup, but after you get past that, it just works. I love being able to automatically transfer files between devices without going through 3rd party cloud providers. Keep up the good work.

if you have a lot of devices and don't want to rely in cloud services to sync all of your files because of privacy reason, this is the perfect software to sync because it doesn't used cloud services, it uses your wifi.

Brilliant app, strongly increased the functionality of my other android based ereader. I have folders synced between laptop, ereader and phone- so wherever i download a new book (or add new notes) on all my devices I'll have the latest version. It all works on local networks, so perfect score on privacy. This is what technology should be about I really absolutely love it. Thank you.

Best for sharing / auto sync the files, photos, any thing between two mobiles. Using to auto sync my new mobile photos to my pixel xl so that it gets backup to Google photos automatically (as pixel xl has unlimited storage for Google photos) Works flowlessly without any issues. Hats off to the developer ..

Stops working with almost no explanation. It's magic when it works but I've repeatedly ended up with a constant "Out of Sync" condition and nothing syncs after that until I reinstall the Android app and re set up the sync task. There needs to be better information and communication to the user
Simple enough
Free, open source, easy to set up thanks to the QR codes and works seamlessly; doesnt get any better than this! Keeping this one to transfer files between devices.d
tends to drain the battery by keeping it always on, otherwise it works fine

"Continually get stuck during transfers. Too inconvenient and clunky to use regularly." 7 years later and it still won't connect on its own. It's default settings will use up your mobile data btw. I expected better.

I looked around and before I found this every similar app was lacking. I thought an app like this did not exist so I started planning to make it myself and every idea I had for it has been implemented and more. I seriously mean it, this is the best free and open folder Syncing software available on the market.

Great to have an open source alternative for local file syncing. Works solid [the issues are 1. the sync conflict (although it's quite rare but still) & 2. The diagnostic data collection by default, not sure if I can turn it off ]
Best

It works very well, at great speed, no problem with it. Very useful and better (if it keeps working like that) than Resilio Sync because it has better speed and has no bug in renaming files. Thanks to the developers!
Failed to sync properly, error unclear, result i lost files i had been carring around since the 90s

A FREE & OPEN SOURCE FILE SYNCHRONIZATION SOFTWARE. PLATFORMS= GO, WINDOWS, macOS, LINUX, ANDROID, BSD & SOLARIS. FEATURES= - DISTRIBUTED P2P SYNC -AUTOMATIC NAT TRAVERSAL -ENCRYPTION - CUSTOM TOPOLOGY (STAR, FULL MESH, MIXED), ONLY CLIENT NEEDED= YES. DETECTS ACTION THAT MAY RESULT IN OPERATION DATA LOSS, ,PROPAGATION OF FILE/DIRECTORY & SAVES BANDWIDTH FOR REMOTE SERVERS, ANALYSIS TIME INCREASED, VERSION CONTROL, (NAS) NETWORK ATTACHED STORAGE, RUN AUTOMATICALLY OR MANUALLY FOR EACH SYNC
Simply the sync app
Only read-only access on SD cards, you can't send files to your phone.
Must be for super Geeks. Not clear what can be done with this, and how
Cool! But add github account option for destination syncing please!!
Best syncing app ever, and it's open source.
the best way to sync files between platforms

Indispensable. Silent seamless fast continuous folder syncing (no cloud middleman) over LAN or internet. // An unfathomable ZERO issues over 5 nonstop years, multiple PCs & phones, untold error-free exabytes transferred. My faith & trust is unshakeable. These devs should be writing all software for everything. // Some tech savvy (or determined googling) may be helpful to setup correctly. Grab your favorite computer knowitall if you need to. Well worth the effort ‚Äî I cannot overstate that.

By far the best way to keep specific folders in sync between multiple devices. I use it to manage my notes, music, voice recordings, and digital photos across a laptop, desktop, and phone without any need for Google.

What is syncthing? The description here, and on the syncthing web site doesn't really cover what its purpose is. It's essentially a replacement for existing sync protocols. Syncthing tool needs to be installed on BOTH sides, your phone, and your NAS. Nice idea but not for me. I just want good FTP and SMB syncs without reinventing the wheel. OK it isn't designed to do that - BUT I had to go and find that out. Needs a better description here (I wasted some time).

Only detail that is really negative - and it is a serious problem - is that I cannot get this app to stay connected to the Syncthing network. To get files updated I have to manually reconnect via the GUI. The connection stays briefly then gets lost. For some reason the "Run on specified WiFi networks" won't connect until I turn the network options all off and back on again.

Pretty cool. Rclone that doesnt require cloud service. Saving bandwidth. For sync TO android, need to use web gui. For new user this might be confusing at first. Also make sure to turn off your phone's auto delete junk. That thing mess up syncthing.
Everyone should really switch to this over... whatever it is they're using. The best.
Doesn't do the activities it claims to. False advertising.
Great app. Very easy to transfer a lot of files and directories as long as you aren't using a micro SD card. Great PC support too, really appreciate Linux support.
Go for itüòç
SO HELPFUL MAN, it does what it's supposed to, may just be a bit demanding of battery and processing usage
i love you

Works flawlessy for my uses: pushing copies of work docs from multiple desktop folders to my phone for reference at job sites and syncing forms used to record data in the field. Syncing can be configured on a per-folder basis to meet your needs. I also use (and love) desktop versions to sync a Windows desktop amd Linux laptop. Very useful group of apps.
Not working

Doesn't allow folder access to the full android directory. This is a huge problem and defeats the purpose of the app. The folked version is miles better, if only it was able to actually connect to other devices I'd be using it instead. Fix the storage permissions to allow access to the full directory not just the downloads folder. As it stands if you accidentally delete the default camera folder from the install the only way to add it back is by reinstalling the app. Disgraceful

This app is amazing. I use it to manage my photos, and it manages to keep the metadata correct. No other solution I found for my specific workflow and use-case did that correctly. 5 stars once it has a material you icon for Android 13.

Love this app. Thanks so much for building it. I would like to see it be able to access the Android Data folder where some apps save data that I would want to sync. Please consider implementing the access request to Android Data folder in the same way that FX File Explorer accesses the Android Data folder.
Decentralized file sharing
Please make it work with WiFi only, without internet connection. This should be the base.
This app is best if you want to avoid using cloud storage and want to share anything between your devices. Easy interface, powerful functionality.
Nice App , very useful, full free ,very transparent options
This app is great! Love being able to sync data from one phone to another seamlessly And reliably.

Brilliant! Works flawlessly. I use this app primarily to sync my Obsidian notes between 3 devices (1 MacOS and 2 Android). I now also use it to sync my music library between devices. I can edit mp3 tags or add new files on any device and the changes automatically flow through to the other devices.
SyncKing‚Ñ¢

I am in love with this app! Had no idea what it was until I played around with it. Until now I thought it's a folder sync app with Google drive or something. Also, you can sync any folder from any device with any folder on any device! And the decentralised nature is brilliant! Why did I not find it earlier and why aren't everyone using computers using this! Thanks a ton dev!

Want your own "cloud" while avoiding the drawbacks? I've been using Syncthing for a long time and I love it.. With it, I have 100% Control over my own data and Zero worries about creepy corps doing who knows what with it including syncing photos from my phone (or any device) across multiple devices (even Linux). Simple to set up! The app works flawlessly. I really like that I can set up run rules to control syncing over data/wifi. Also, No Ads! Hooray. ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞
Very good app and might be an alternative for Google rrive and photos
This app after backuping my files and deleting it from my main device it deleted the files from my backup device which is very dump
Amazing app
Works pretty well but takes a bit to setup. I wish I could allow certain syncs to use data without allowing them all.
Works great

Fix it .... For now garbage program & personally a broken program Some of us want a one-way sync only (never auto delete via this program both ends) Why do U hide the do not delete command in webpage when you do try to prevent deletion by the program it always says out of sync it doesn't work... Just think see This should be an option @ both ends One way mode "on" "sender one way mode" (ignore deletion from receiver)' Yes / no "Receiver one way mode" (ignore deletion from sender) Yes / no
this is insidious bug ridden trash. avoid. you get what you pay for!!!
Love the desktop version, android app is very difficult to set up. My 2nd attempt after waiting a month inspired me to throw it a star (bone).
Latest seems is working. The very slow startup is fixed.
Thank! Best app for sync

Hmmm. Local sync was quite smooth and very very fast, encrypted sync worked with the web GUI but is pretty strange and mistake-prone and caused crashes for a few minutes until it didn't, and while my devices could pull metadata like name from relays, they couldn't actually sync anything at all for some reason. So it's a mixed bag. Seems like some of the fundamentals are in place, and I'm thrilled to see untrusted storage, but there's a lot not yet done to make it usable.
Works pretty well, except that it doesn't account for differences in valid file names across platforms.
Great way to synchronize your data with all your devices.
Does not tell me how to set up write-to-phone permission
Essential
Solid performance and really convinient. . I sync between mobile devices and a PC everyday without issues.

Still the case now in mid 2022. I can no longer trust the "run conditions" settings built into three outside app. So I have to allow it to run on metered connections, which can be dangerous and costly. ORIGINAL REVIEW from mid 2021: Latest update makes it so my home's "T-Mobile Home Internet" (unmetered) WiFi is seen as metered to Syncthing and thus makes it not run.... Otherwise, this is one of my must have apps on any of my devices. Period.
Great app. Automatic synchronisation between devices, backup etc.
Best app
In this crazy world this is a breath of fresh air.
Very useful app which transparently syncs directories between computers and phones.

Works great! Took some figuring and doc diving to get things just right, but it's amazing once configured. I've got everything configured all local network and it's sweet. I can appreciate the defaults for using global servers as a convenience for getting started, but I'm more the type that would have preferred opening to the documentation first and not having global on by default. Maybe an idea for the future. A splash screen to present fast and easy, or advanced defaults.
Wonderful experience It runs very smoothely. I have suggestion . I wanted only so.e specific folders to sync with the internet conncetion if direct to direct conncetion is not there
Does the thing

IMPORTANT: DATA LOSS will happen if you: - replace an underscore '_' with a dash '-' in a file or folder name shared from a PC. - change the capitalization of a letter (For example change 'a' to 'A') in a file or folder name shared from a PC. The renamed item will be deleted on all devices without notice the next time SyncThing on Android synchronizes. Google: "SyncThing Renaming caused file deletion bug." I have unknowingly lost a bunch of files over time due to this.
This is such an awesome app! It's like having a personal cloud storage system. I set up a 300gb folder and have synced it across a whole bunch of computers. Convenient and free!
does what I wanted it to do....
Works great, takes little while to setup right. Overall it works awesome

A bit slow at resolving other nodes at times, the UI doesn't show the most 
recent info half the time ‚Äî but it's reliable when it comes to keeping 
files in sync.
R/W folder is "out of sync" and just sits there and does nothing.
I wish I can sync my life together
The only way I can get it to sync is to restart the daemon
Keep having out of sync message on android. Both android and pc is on. struck at 56% 8 gb for days. pls help
GREAT INDEED !! ! !! 26/4/22 WAYMAN
Most useful app on the Play Store rn. My favourite OpenSource app.

thanks so much again. just want to say this works great when syncing from my oneplus nord n10 to my chromebook (syncthing on both) and to my macbook (syncthing from website) and to my iphone (mobius syncthing). best if keep simple -- like one folder to sync. i tried adding more folders to sync, but syncthing kept stopping at different %s. so, you cannot do too much??? oh well. so, for my purposes, got to keep it simple to only one folder (although that can have a subfolder). thx!
Takes some setting up. Still has some bugs. Mostly though it works very well. It is open-source.
Not syncing files. It says 900MB/900MB done but the folder is 200GB...
Does show "Loading ..." on a Chromebook since hours after installation. I am not even able to configure a cloud share.
Fantastico, works flawlessly
No longer works with large files on Android.
Excellent!
Sadly, this is nonfunctional on ASUS Chromebox 4, Intel Core i5 with 8GB RAM (2021 model). Fails to load, just keeps spinning and spinning...
Has been working flawlessly for years syncing phones, laptops and servers!
Great app. Works well to sync files between your devices. Be sure to check out their website so you can get it on other operating systems.

Good app. Would be great if there was an option to run the app or the syncing during a specified time period, when computer is on for example, to reduce the significant battery drain this app causes. Using automate to kill the app at specific time requires root access, otherwise it would've been perfect.
So far great. Only seems to use quite a bit of battery when I leave it running on mobile data. It would be great if I could disable the notification and run it scheduled.
Update 1.19.1 somehow broke the ability to display the folders with the most file explorers. Google Files, My files from Samsung, CX Explorer Otherwise it's a great app, sync is fast and reliable
Fantastic. I have Syncthing on multiple devices and computers. When I connect to my home WiFi it automatically syncs my camera roll.
One of a kind app. Thank you and keep up the good work!
Very flexible, solid.
Works great, a bit hard to manuever thou.
Did not work on Lineage OS 14 (unofficial) [SM-T705]. Otherwise, Neat, Free and Private on Official Marshmallow [SM-T705], as well as other devices ever since!
It doesn't always start when plugged into AC power when set to only run on AC for battery savings.
Excellent app! I was able to setup automatic synchronization of my music collection to my phone. Previously it was very painful process of copying everything manually.
Best universal sync option available

Great app. Worked quite well, and for someone who is a bit tech-inclined, is easy enough. However, update to v1.19.0 and database reset did not work as intended. Syncing between an Android 11 and Android 12 device broke, devices are shown as disconnected. Deleting and re-adding did not help, neither did the hotfix update. Going to try deinstalling, rebooting, re-installing next. --- Updated some 30 min later: up and running. And I'm impressed with the speed, again.

Effing awesome. Once you install this app (and the corresponding server version), it almost takes care of itself. I wouldn't recommend this without a good foundation of knowledge of networks/networking. Also need to know something about servers and whatever server you're going to throw this on! Otherwise, magnificent app!

Started freezing and crashing immediately while trying to synchronize a few GiB over WiFi. Finally deleted several GiB from the source thanks to lousy defaults, poor UI, and general unreliability. Don't use for anything at all valuable until you're sure all your settings are perfect and everything is backed up twice over.
It's unclear how to connect to a lan. The app doesn't scan lan PCs

An excellent open source alternative to Resilio Sync. Works very well within a LAN and also via a WAN. Edit: Database reset for version 1.19.0 causes Syncthing to stop on Android 6 (confirmed on two Android 6 devices). Syncthing restarts to this "database reset" screen and I'm stuck in a recursive loop, with no access to Syncthing on my Android 6 devices. However, the process worked on my Android 11 device.
I love the desktop version but this review is for the Android version. The app keeps stopping on my phone and won't start at all on my Samsung Chromebook.
So far so good

Worked fine up until latest update, now database flush can't finish correctly or at all. Only way to make app work again is to delete its data and then list all folders again. Otherwise works just fine when and if you'll set it up correctly.
Working good if you take out the horrible set-up thing of folder's with their synchronisation .. ripping hair out to clean all out on synchronous servers
Keeps on my files synchronized between my phone tablet and computer
Im learning to use it ... Because it seems to be a powerfull tool app thanks for your work. I like it so much
Awesome! I virtually replaced everything I used gdrive for with this
Can't fathom where the heck to get a 'device id' for a server directory. Very hard to find help, not well structured.
A backup (technically sync) tool for power users, I find it very useful!
Trivial to set up on Windows, this is the easiest way I've found so far to transfer files Android <-> Windows
Fastest personal cloud file sync! Secure and reliable, faster then seafile, waaaay faster than next loud and owncloud

Using it transfer hundreds and hundreds of accumulated camera files from the phone to a SMB share on my home network via wiFi. Name tokens allow me to put them in a time-based folder structure of /year/month/imageName... Ex:. /2018/05/img20180517_etc.jpg Timestamps of the files are maintained, I was happy to discover. Nothing to complain about, it's getting the job done and quickly.

Great app but I wish that there was an option to delete the files that have been synced from one device to another. So that way I don't have copies on the original device so I can just keep them on the device I'm sending them to.
Extreme power usage for no reason has drained my battery twice this week alone. Honestly a non-starter at this point...

Very fast when syncing 1 file change in a folder with 2000 files. Changes are synced within 10 seconds or so. This is a big boost compared to other cloud-based third-party tools. (I use Syncthing to synchronize my Zotero collection, with some 2000 PDF files, between my PC and an e-ink tablet. Despite the slow download speed logged on the e-ink table, a single file change gets synced within 10 seconds or so. This is very much usable for going paperless.) Previously, per my testing with FolderSync Pro, it was not clear to me until I email the author that FolderSync was checking one thing at a time, and one folder-pair at a time. This process can take up to 5 minutes for a folder with 4000 files. For the poor e-ink tablet, it has logged some 30 minutes wait time for syncing a single file-change. I am now gladly settled with the Syncthing setup. Cheers and Kudos!
It just works.

Mostly reliable app. Every now and then it has to be opened to get it to start working again but, for my purposes, mostly back up, not an issue. Works nicely with syncthing on my other devices (NAS, Windows). Question: This hasn't be updated in a couple of months. Is it being abandoned?
My neverending search for best synchronisation app ends here.
So good! Can sync 2 ways from my phone to my NAS or PC

I was only looking for a way to send a folder from one device to another. Looking for options I stumble upon this app. I thought it will easily sync both my device but I soon as I open it, I have no idea what to do. Checked out some tutorials but it doesn't seem to connect with my other device. Overall, this app is for advance users. UI is clean & easy to navigate but everything else is not newbie friendly, so I'll pass on this one.

Syncs your files over LAN or over the internet! Works well...unless you choose to encrypt files synced between Android devices. I'm disappointed in the management of - what I suppose is - the overhead involving file encryption. I always run into trouble with droids here. I suppose, from what I've read, that the RAM is the problem, but one could still handle it more elegantly. Not gonna throw shade at the devs for this, as it would involve clever manipulation of the droids RAM allowances, I think

Used to work well. Has android 12 broken it? When trying to sync photos from my Pixel 6pro to Pixel 2, when choosing the photos folder on the 6Pro and touching the toggle switch for the Pixel 2, the request to setup a folder to match on the Pixel 2 is not received by the Pixel 2. It's works the other way round, but that's not what I need.
Scam
No write or read permission to SD so it does not sync

Used to work very well, now it doesn't work at all. 2021-Oct: stuck "Syncthing is taking very long to load. Use the logs to check for any errors. Clicked "Open Log" and the logs are empty. Watched it eat more ram over five minutes while it was still "loading." Tried rebooting my phone, tried re-installing Syncthing. I'm sad that I can't use Syncthing anymore.
cok kullanisli ve islevsel.
Great app! I own my own cloud ‚òÅÔ∏è!
Performs well but does stop when set to only run on AC power.

Ditch every comercial application that you know and install syncthing! This is a decentralized and encrypted way to backup your own files and folders without limits in storage space and advertisers snooping through your files. You host it! You own it! You can have as much space as you want! Encrypted and without central week points! Some learning curve exists but is it totally worth it!
Best open source alternative for all computer to mobile and vise versa syncing things or data in the market, Just amazing thing every I found in my life.üòçüòçü§©
Absolutely game-changer!! Must have for all
Excelent app
Just works.
So good

It's a mostly-good tool, and I don't know of one of its kind that does it better, but it's a mixed bag. Pros: Free and Open Source decentralized file syncing, robust platform support, functional UI, respect for privacy, good feature set, and it usually works. Cons: It's difficult to get set up, the phone app can burn through a lot of battery life, and it can have a delete scare or two with treating a half-synced version as the master copy. After some learning and some caution, it's good enough.

Looks promising but I cannot find an option to sync files from my Android device to a Synology NAS. Cannot find an option to configure an IP address only ID scan. The idea of NOT using IP addresses is fine, but excludes a lot of devices because you need a special syncthing app for all those devices. Will investigate the app more.
On Chrome OS it is just loading indefinately not letting me do anything.
Great
Bad, why does it not allow write access to an androids sd card?

Does the syncing, but... Firstly it devours Android battery like a monster, secondly - devs got into politics, so wouldn't recommend for any business solution. Think what if any of IT kids decides your tweet was "incorrect" or something.
Excellent app for syncing.
I needed help to get it set up (although I'm not a super technical person) but it's worked absolutely fine once I got it up and running.
Worked like a charm. I paired it with syncthing on my PC.
It works well. The only problem I found is that it won't start automatically when rebooting the phone although this setting is on.
Superb tool. Does exactly what I need, eg syncing photos from various devices to my nas
After restart, username password resets back to default like syncthing, which is very bad & annoying. So make it to remember like in pc & mac.
Couldn't get it to work syncing a tiny text file with Ubuntu.... It kept getting stuck on 89% and creating an empty file. Can't trust it if it's so wobbly straight out the gate!
Wonderful app.. most productive and good idea
Works well, has a nice, clear, convenient interface, can do everything you would expect it to :)
Perfect!
No battery problems here and I sync about 11 folders.
Better for backups than third-party cloud services

Love it, may uninstall/stop. -it's a big power hog, and on pc it's a total performance hog. -requires constant attention, as there's a warning or failure in almost every transfer. -very counter-intuitive (it has two UIs with different features) -the option to only work when charging stops transfers, but for some reason it's still a power hog (tested with Ampere). It's still a powerful and unique tool, but it's very hard to recommend, it needs you to check it constantly
Took a long time to make this work. Very confusing to-and-from folders-devices.BUT it does work across wifi home network on android and (win10).
Great tool, very cool and free
Does not sync, never seen such a user unfriendly app

recording to a flash drive on non-rooted devices does not work. this is not an android problem, it is specifically so made by the developer. the program is useless. the author removes negative reviews
Came from resillo sync nice to see an open source option
Great app easy to use
The best app, I needed such app from soooo long, thankyou
It looks very interesting but it's too much difficult
Might be a good app. But it says it will not even start when power save modus is on, which is default on my phone because it's way fast enough...
i think this is one of the best utilities to those who want to manange files cross platform. learning curve and OS compatibilities may impose a few limitations.

Fantastic, very helpful at keeping control of your own files. Take advantage of all that extra disc space you have on various computers to make your own backups and share files with your family. There are many YouTube videos to help you get it set up and working. Lots of choices for managing battery life and privacy.
Painful, a real pain to get it to work but took hours of fiddling. Upgraded laptop and it never worked again. Given up. Wouldn't waste my time again.
Was hoping to not have to go the linux route to get this on a chromebook.

My preferred file synchronizer. Works great. With Android 11, synchronizing to an external SD card is fixed. (This pain point was caused by Android OS policy in previous versions, and was out of Syncthing's control.) Hear hear for a great tool!
Amazing.

This app really is the swiss army knife of syncing files. It's a little complicated to setup but once it's setup it works great. I use this to keep a copy of all my photos and videos backed up to my Qnap NAS. Works like a champ.

This app is really great. Very fast file sync between devices. It's free, secure and decentralized. I just love it. Lots of thanks for those who are working so hard for making and keep running such an wonderful app‚ù§Ô∏è

it is extremely useful if you want a way to sync multiple files on multiple devices (excluding ios) even over 4G or other networks. however it drains a lot of battery when always running. Wish the sd card support could be improved instead of relying on the app folder on devices pre android 11. Was hard to use at first but managed to understand after trying some test folders. Another must have app on my phone.

google_play_reviews.userName: Abdul Qoyyuum Haji Abdul Kadir (Agent Q)
google_play_reviews.content: For anyone who wants more control on their data storage, this is what you should get

A bit difficult to set up but worth it. Syncs between PC and Android (possibly the only option available). Works with folders of other sync clients (OneDrive, Google Drive, Mega etc). You can directly put a file in your phone and then later get it automatically synced into your cloud drive via computer. It does not have the speed and storage limits of using cloud storage alternatives. You can share folders over internet! It is free without any bells and whistles. What to complain about?

This is a great, free and open source software for synchronizing files. It's great for backups, as well as making notes, password manager databases, photos etc. available on multiple mobile devices and computers.

Missing the days of BitTorrent Sync this app is an excellent replacement. It can be slightly more complicated, but it should work right out of the box. Can't imagine using anything else. I'm not sure there is anything comparable in terms of cross platform support.

All app have write access in sd card root folder Except the sycthing. Phone/OS : Poco MIUI. -----PLEASE FIX THIS ---------------in other apps there will be apopup for the permission page but it is not asking in this app
üî¥ Maximum stars just because of the principles it promotes and stands for.
Doesnt sync sdcard

To be honest I just downloaded this app to try 1 way sync from PC to my phone SD card. Unfortunately your device must be rooted for this to be done. (Conclusion: Imma think that Resilio Sync does better in this task.)
Works well
Works fine!
Crashing on Android 9 when I try to ignore a shared folder. Otherwise, love syncthing! Thanks so much for this app. :)
I like

Bulletproof syncing between desktop and mobile. He doesn't do two-way singing to the SD card, but this is not the developers fault. It can do two-way sinking to the internal storage of the device allowing me to synchronize any folders I want between my phone and my different computers.
Awesome

So far, its working great. Only that setup still is a mess üòÖ 3 point sync sometimes can be confusing. If theres a table to show sync 1 way 2 way between these points. Else, it is a spider web thing.
Life saving! Good gets better.
Works perfectly all the time.
Nothing short of a great app. Thanks devs.

Something I was looking for years. I use it to syanc my files between android - mac - araspberry pi. Only wished it it were more optimised for battery. Thus, I prefer running it once I'm about to finish my work and sync it then instead of keep it running all time.
Not intuitive to setup. It works but not simple like folder sync app. It's working on Android 11 for me

This is extremely reliable and quick. Best way to access files like photos from your phone on any computer. Apart from that, I'm using syncthing to sync files between my server and several of my computers. Very happy.
Sync two laptops to my phone. Works great
Invaluable tool.
Works but destroys battery. Going to try the fork instead that is on the store
Been running this for the best part of a year now and I forget it's even there (to clarify, this is a good thing). Really appreciate all the work that's been put into this project. Thanks.

Amazing, syncthing is one of those mindblowing experiences you can have in computing. The GUI is a dream to work with after hacking woth rsync scripts, is easy to setup on Windows as well and does daemonizing and traversing networks like a champ. Nothing to setup or configure, works out of the box. üëçüëç

completely and utterly confusing ... installed ... expect 1 nominate files/folders to sync 2 nominate sync location/device 3 set sync type/frequency 4 go got ... still not sure what the f@#$ i got ... basically appears to be useless for what it's intended to do ... can't be i know but interface is so bad it might as well be useless

Syncthing makes it much easier to manage my manual backups. I use it to keep backups of all my photos and files on my NAS. It's becoming more and more important with the recent changes to google photos. I'll admit it's not trivial to use. Personally, I'm a software developer by trade and it took me several trial and errors before I got it syncing like I wanted it to. That being said, I don't think anyone could build this solution better. Pretty awesome for free.üòÄ
Excellent!

I have a personal NAS server and 2 seperate dedicated web servers and I ended up using syncting for my cloud/backup/sync needs. Every other alternative I tried before (including my nas' native apps) disappointed me one way or the other. Syncting is great (so far). It's easy to setup, clean, bug free, ad-free, altogether free so what could anyone want more? Thanks for this great service (and app of course)!
crazy amount of battery usage even when disabled

Works great. Completely free and ad free. Been using it on PC for a while now, and am happy to see the Android version is just as good. (The experience was good enough that I returned to write this review, and I donated to the project.)
Great "personal cloud"

This app is sweet. I love the syncthing service. But the android app could be better. The biggest issue is, data can be sent from another device only to this 1 folder in Android (Android>data>com.nutomic.....>files). It'd be a lot cooler if both ways transfer and sync were possible in any location of our choice. Also, it'd b better if caldav & cardav sync was implemented. Ik you guys won't be doing it, still. Finally. It'd be convenient if a independent sync toggle were there on the quick menu.
Does exactly what it says on the box. Easy to set up and use. I chose to use my always on desktop as a sort of server and my phones and tablets etc feeding it data to share. Works well.

I've been using syncthing for roughly 5 years by this point, I've got it on my desktop, laptop, and phone. I've got my camera on my phone synced up to my desktop, and when I take a picture it ends up there in ~3 seconds. I highly recommend this app (and have been since like 2016, and its gotten way better since then). I specifically recommend syncing pictures, and also syncing a password database (i use KeepassXC for desktop and they have an android app as well).

Very CPU intencive. I have one of flagships and the CPU is running at 100% and phone itself is at 70C for over 6 hours now, while syncing some photos. What the hell is it doing?? And transfer speed over wifi is very slow, 500kB/s or so.
Probao sam 100 njih pre I radi savrseno na Windows linux android. Ipak, ne radi kako treba pod Kodi/OpenELEC Linux, ne prevlaƒçi sve datoteke i prijavljuje da je sinhronizavija zavrsena

Works perfectly to completely back up my entire galaxy s20 Plus onto an external hard drive in my computer and it sinks instantly without draining the battery even though it's running, scanning and syncing 24/7. This will be a de facto app once Google photos will limit users to how many photos and videos they can upload starting next year. Make sure File Versioning is set to "trash can" on your PC otherwise your files will be deleted on the PC if you delete it on your phone.
5 stars, but is there a way to get rid of the persistent notification when on battery? I have Syncthings set to run only when I'm charging.
Trash app, one single folder shared with 120 MB and 50 files - drained the battery to 30% by just having it open.
This is a truly great app. I'm worried about what Google's seemingly heavy handed API changes regarding legacy storage will do to it. If I wanted an iPhone I would have bought one.
Very easy to setup once you understand how the information flow works... It works wonders and without any further interaction

Without write access on sd card absolutely useless to me. Will start again using Resilio sync (which has also the option to share single files). Syncthing is OK. But Resilio offers more functionality.

An indispensable tool for any power user. I use it to keep my movies and music on my phone in sync with my computer. The Android app works quite well... this app is so great it's singlehandedly enough to keep me on Android!

Thank you for providing this app, it's a nice alternative to proprietary cloud services, however it lacks a bit of UX, e.g. - the states are not clearly defined (sometimes the app is simply stuck in a state where it does nothing). - there is no indication which folders are currently syncing. - the current throughput of a server is not really informative, a history of which files has been uploaded/download would be more useful. - the notification does not add any useful info. - a step-by-step wizard could be added to make the install process easier, currently there is not even any "direct" feedback that will tell the user what is actually going wrong. This would imho help people with a non-technical background a lot.

Super useful, folder syncing between devices ... without expensive cloud service. If i dont run across glitches, this is gonna be one of my favorite apps. Makes things so much easier. One suggestion.... Dark theme option please, your app should be very easy to apply a dark theme toggle to. When you update the app with a dark theme toggle, i will change rating to 5 stars.

The best in the market
This app doesn't appear to work at all on the Pixelbook i7. Never gets past an initial loading page. Is it intended to work for Chromebooks?
Can use lots of battery while connected to wifi, but seems to happen rarely.
Works perfectly as it should.
Brilliant piece of open source software.I walk around with my files in my pocket, whilst being able to edit them. Keeps track of everything.

Very useful apps! Now I can access Cryptomator even without internet connection and ditched third party cloud services... Well, not totally. Keep it up guys!
Excellent app, simplifies file sync, you can finally get rid of public cloud dependency.
No external sdcard access.Worthless.

4.5 stars really. The one gripe I have with the application is the barcode scanner. The application should be able to use native barcode scanner rather than downloading another barcode scanner app. Otherwise, this application is pure sugar. Sweet! Love it.
Abit confusing to setup at the beginning but everythinf work perfectly and flawless
The best sync app for inter device backup. Hands down
Easy to set up, ready to use. Working great
A must have app for everybody. Does everything Dropbox does and more. No limit to the number of devices, arbitrary capacity, slow speeds, or big brother possibly spying on you. And free!
best sync tool out there
I use this to keep a copy of my whole phone in my home folder on my computer.
Awesome sync app. Simple but brilliant solution. No more cloud services to back up your phone data, such as pictures.
Sometimes i have to use web api for something. But generally great app.
Fantastic and reliable. Helps me sync files consistently between devices. Thank you.
Clean and easy to use sync app. Love it on desktop and mobile.
The app is amazing! It's a fantastic project.

Too hard to use and not enough information to work around that. Easy unless you want things ignored. Way to hard to sync one only folder ignoring all subdirectories. No way to tell if a filter is ok (no way to tell if it's going to fun your files before you have done so). Will go back to FolderSync app.

so nice to sync music and photos with my laptop. if it uses too much battery for you, sync your stuff then turn it off. works perfectly. 11/2/20 update - still using this app and just set it up again on my new phone. Such an amazing app that I felt compelled to give another 5 stars. Well done.
Perfect

Why the hell do I have to enable all the sync and power settings so that I can check setting. Good God this is so basic even windows has it figured out. I remembered now why I started using syncthing-fork. It wasn't stupid. Unfortunately it hasn't been updated to Android 11 yet.
One of its kind. Exceptional
Just lacking one feature- Selective Sync.
The most clever way to share. If I share the same folder to multiple machines at multiple locations with versioning turned on, it is also an excellent back-up method.
Very useful and reliable
It is hard to use. And especially why does folder names turn to white? They create so much confusion.
Awesome tool. Out of box transfer. Device setup is little bit complicated. Not easily understood.
This is a great application. It works well. And the security and implementation is very good as well. It does take a little bit to get used to, but once you do it just works!
It's a pretty reliable app to use Syncthing, no major complaints other than having to force stop and start the app again when it wouldn't sync from time to time

This is a fantastic project, great software! It does take a bit of time and effort to understand how to make it all work, but that's well spent for a reliable method of maintaining synchronized directories across machines no matter their location, network, or OS.
Thank you for this great app!
Best!
Dear developers, I have version 10 of Android. The send and receive function does not work on it. Writes that: Your Android version provides Syncthing with read-only access to the selected folder.
amazingly good! thanks!

Absolutely love Syncthing. It is reliable, capable a d trustworthy. I use it everyday.
Very useful software, if you want to own your data. If you do not want your data then use a cloud service.
Only readonly on Android. That's a pity. Hence it is useless for me. The first app I experience, that is not able to write.
I love the app and use it quite aften. Thank you. One annoying thing though. If set to disabled when on mobile data, and you are not on wifi, impossible to shut down the app :(

Simple to sync. Total control on who is the sync partner and content. On Android the only negativ aspect is no sd card support (today). The focus of sync thing is control and transparency. If you need 'fleet' sync the other major player might be the better option.

It's amazing. Sync a directory. No fuss, no muss. You know that xkcd comic where he points out that it's actually difficult to send any file larger than "tiny"? SyncThing. You know how there's all manner of "automatically back up from your phone to your PC"? SyncThing. And it doesn't dump your synced stuff in some bizarre database either, it's just a normal file. No silly process to get your own data back.
Love it

The app removed all my files from my phone üò° I just wanted to share folder from my phone to my tablet. But something went wrong. Instead of coping files from my phone to tablet, it started syncing in reverse way. It copied empty folder from the tablet to the phone, removing all content of the folder on the phone. Thank you very much.

C√® un Bug in questa versione: le credenziali assegnate per l'accesso remoto via WebGUI spesso si resettono ritornando Random...rende di fatto impossibile accedervi da remoto. Per il resto tutto ok, le due stelle sono per attirare l'attenzione e risolvere il problema

I just want to sync folders between Desktop, Laptop and two Android devices. It took me about an hour to figure it all out on both platforms and get them talking to each other. It works how I want, but the Android app is just so much of a pain that I've decided to uninstall it and find another solution instead. 1. It depletes my battery like no other app (this relates to two difference devices). 2. I have to accept an icon at the top of the screen whenever it's running. Or remove it manually and get a constant warning from the battery monitor. 3. Stopping the battery monitor watching & optimising the app doesn't remove that icon. 4. If I restart the phone I then have to launch syncthing manually (even though it's supposed to run automatically) to start the syncing process. Apparently point 3 sfixes this... except it doesn't. I give up. Time to revert to a paid solution because at least it will just work out of the box without so many problems.
While it doesn't replace proper backups, having your data synchronised on all your devices gives a level of serenity. Doesn't seem to start automatically after an Android reboot for some reason.
Migrating all my syncing things to syncthing. After a longer time running I still recommend it. :)
this is the way
Really easy to setup with QR code scanning from phone. Easiest NAS file sync I've ever used (tried a bunch).
one time setup and done.
Works like a charm. Has a steep learning curve but after some time it is easy

Syncs Android to Android, Linux and Windows brilliantly without problems once the hidden .thumbs directories were excluded. Take pics, instant replication to laptop/tablet and shortly after they can be safe at home. Sorted.
best way to sync content securely and its OPEN SOURCE
Highly customizable!
Perfect open source software which I highly trust.
Perfect - avoid version 1.5 as it has sync problems. Get the APK.

Very good indeed. Is it possible to have per-folder switch on "Run Condition"? Some "messaging app" backups are just too big to run on mobile network.

Security keeps my files in sync on Linux, Android and Chrome OS.

Good for backup your device or particular folder. For me I am changing ROM a lot and I need to format my internal storage and for me this application is best for backup the whole device without losing.
